bug.author: taochenshh
bug.summary: Error for histogram visualization (Expected binary or unicode string, got)?
bug.description: Hi, I am using pytorch 0.4.1. And I installed the lastest tensorboardX. I can call writer.add_histogram successfully. But when I use tensorboard to visualize it. It gives me the TypeError:Expected binary or unicode string, got . A minimal example to reproduce the error is: import numpy as np from tensorboardX import SummaryWriter writer = SummaryWriter(log_dir='./log') v = np.random.uniform(0, 5, (64,3,7,7)) writer.add_histogram('x', v, 0, bins='sqrt') Note: I installed tensorflow 1.10 as well.

comments.comment: I just confirmed the bug (with tensorboard 1.9.0) and will look into this. a quick work around would be removing the bins argument. writer.add_histogram('x', v, 0)
That was a horrible bug. Thanks for the report.
This still happens with SummaryWriter with TB 1.12.0 and TBX 1.2.
Wait, it's the version on pypi that is outdated, can you update it?
